title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 11/15/2023 INC#0848

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0848; 01:16PM; 6801 W Hollywood Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/2Sxiwoq; #Hollywood; LAFD Firefighters quickly handled a small fire in the wall of a first floor shoe store at the four story Ovation Hollywood shopping center (northwest corner of Hollywood Blvd/Highland Ave) with evidence of minimal heat, smoke or fire extending in a void space as high as the fourth floor. No injury. No evacuation. All businesses have resumed normal operations. The specific cause of this fire was unable to be determined.; FS 27; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 BC14 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 CM52 E203 E227 E229 E235 E261 E27 E52 E61 E76 E82 EM18 HR3 RA41 RA82 SQ21 T27 T29 T3 T35 T61 UR27 UR88; CH7; 12 14; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 11/15/2023 INC#0950

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0950; 01:19PM; 9049 S Normandie Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/47yJHQT; #GramercyPark; *Address Corrected* 60 LAFD Firefighters, assisted by neighboring Los Angeles County firefighters in Automatic Aid, took just 21 minutes in a well-coordinated offensive firefighting operation, to confine the intense flames within a 30' x 50' one-story barber shop, sparing the adjacent two story apartment building from harm. No injury. The cause of the fire is the focus of an active LAFD investigation.; FS 57; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC13 CM22 CM40 CM42 E205 E221 E226 E233 E266 E5 E57 E64 E65 E66 E95 EA1 EM13 RA64 RA857 SO1 SQ95 T10 T21 T26 T5 T66 UR5 + LACoFD Automatic Aid; CH7; 15 1; Brian Humphrey

Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0950; 12:58PM; 1401 W 90th Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3SO0mMp; #GramercyPark; *Address Tentative*. PRELIM: Offensive firefight at a 30' x 50' one-story commercial building with heavy fire showing. Adjacent residential structure threatened.; FS 57; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC1 BC11 BC13 CM22 CM40 CM42 E205 E221 E226 E233 E266 E5 E57 E64 E65 E66 E95 EA1 EM13 RA64 RA857 SQ95 T10 T21 T26 T5 T66 UR5 + LACoFD Automatic Aid; CH9; 15, 1; Brian Humphrey

Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0848; 12:12PM; 6801 W Hollywood Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/2Sxiwoq; #Hollywood; PRELIM: Four story retail building (northwest corner of Hollywood Blvd/Highland Ave) with a small fire in the wall of a first floor shoe store now under control, with evidence that heat, smoke or fire may have extended as high as the fourth floor. No injury. No formal evacuation. ; FS 27; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 BC14 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 E203 E227 E229 E235 E261 E27 E52 E61 E76 E82 EM18 HR3 RA41 RA82 SQ21 T27 T29 T3 T35 T61 UR27 UR88; CH9; 12 14; Brian Humphrey

Vegetation Fire; INC#0683; 10:48AM; 403 W Av 33; MAP: https://bit.ly/3MLNpPj; #LincolnHeights; PRELIM: LAFD ground crews are actively managing a series of small and slow-burning vegetation fires east of the Golden State Freeway / Arroyo Seco Parkway interchange, adjacent to the Arroyo Seco (Flood Control Channel) / Los Angeles River confluence. #LATraffic: In an effort to most quickly contain and extinguish the fires before they can cause infra/structure damage, the LAFD has asked the CHP to close multiple lanes on the north and southbound Golden State (I-5) Freeway and the the Arroyo Seco Parkway (SR110) near the I-5/SR110 Freeway interchange for an unknown duration. Motorists, expect congestion and delay, avoid the immediate area and consider an alternate route. Monitor traffic reports on news radio. This series of fires is considered suspicious and under active LAFD investigation as a possible criminal act. Media Inquiries: CHP Central L.A (Log #995); FS 1; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; AR1 AR9 BC2 E1 E12 E201 E4 E44 T1; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

ARSON SUSPECT ARRESTED - MEDIA ADVISORY; 10:30AM; #BoyleHeights / #Chinatown; Between 7:00 AM and 8:00 AM this morning (Wednesday, November 15, 2023), the Los Angeles City Fire Department responded to and quickly extinguished approximately 12 intentionally set vegetation and debris fires in the Boyle Heights and Chinatown area. The fires thankfully caused no injury or structural damage. Thanks to a detailed suspect description provided to LAFD responders, teams of Investigators from the LAFD Arson/Counter-Terrorism Section, working closely with the Los Angeles Police Department's Major Crimes Division, were immediately deployed to the area. Shortly after 8:00 AM, the adult male suspect was detained and subsequently arrested for the felony crime of Arson (451(d) P.C. - Arson of Property). At this time, there is no known connection between this suspect and other fires. The Los Angeles City Fire Department appreciates members of the community who stepped forward to help identify this suspect. Anyone who witnesses active fire setting should call 9-1-1 immediately. Those who have information regarding previous arson fires or an arson suspect in the City of Los Angeles, are encouraged to use the LAPD's 24 hour anonymous tip line at 1-877-LAPD 24-7 (1-877-527-3247). MEDIA NOTE: At this time, there is no suspect identity, booking photo or other detailed incident information available; - Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0240; 05:32AM; 324 N Firmin St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ufSicZ; #EchoPark; 36 LAFD Firefighters took just 25 minutes to access, confine and extinguish fire within a vacant and structurally unstable 988 square foot one-story home (built 1908). No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 3; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC13 E10 E20 E203 E209 E210 E3 RA3 RA803 T10 T3 T9; CH9; 14; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0202; 05:10AM; 600 S New Hampshire Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/46elYEK; #Koreatown; 53 LAFD Firefighters took just 54 minutes in well-coordinated offensive firefighting operations, to access, confine and fully extinguish stubborn flames within and above the second floor of a three-story building (apparently one story residential/utility above two floors of commercial). No injury, Fire cause under investigation.; FS 13; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC1 BC11 CM20 CM22 E11 E13 E211 E220 E229 E29 E6 EM11 RA13 RA6 RA813 SQ21 T11 T20 T29; CH7; 12 , 13; Brian Humphrey
